newsitem.title: USA: Forte Software says its sales pipeline is strong.
newsitem.headline: Forte Software says its sales pipeline is strong.

text.p: Forte Software Inc's pipeline of pending sales "is strong," with enough deals in the works to meet the company's projections, its chief executive officer said.

CEO Martin Sprinzen also said many of the pending sales are larger than past deals as more and more existing customers return to buy its software for larger scale distributed computing networks. Forte sells software development solutions for creating applications for large network systems.

Speaking to the Hambrecht & Quist Technology Conference, Forte executives repeated that its first quarter operating margin will dip below the fourth quarter's 15 percent by a bit more than its typical seasonal first quarter dip. But Sprinzen criticized the stock market's reaction Friday - when its stock fell 7-7/8 to close at 8-3/4 - to its comments on the margin.

"We are not managing the company to Wall Street expectations, we are managing for long time growth," Sprinzen told reporters. Forte expects an operating margin dip because it is investing heavily in marketing and sales, including hiring some 90 new sales people, and because of usual seasonal factors.
